private_information: You can move only the disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
You must always follow Tower of Hanoi legality: move exactly one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk; only move a clear (top) disk.
Preferred notation for primitive moves: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively achieve the final configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, C, E; right peg has (top->bottom) B, D, without violating the Tower of Hanoi rules and without moving disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.

private_information: You can move only the disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Disks I to O should remain on the left peg in the final configuration; avoid unnecessary moves.
Preferred notation for primitive moves: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
agent_2.goal: Coordinate with agent_1 to achieve the target configuration while keeping disks I through O undisturbed unless absolutely necessary (they are not needed for this instance).

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency of the multi-agent plan.
Ensure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi constraints; ensure agent-specific disk restrictions are never violated; ensure the final state matches the specified goal.
Remove and prevent bookkeeping shortcuts such as token quotas, post-hoc penalties, or unverifiable assumptions. Do not accept 'trust me' steps.
consistency_auditor.goal: Verify that the ordered move sequence is sound, complete for the stated goal, respects agent permissions, and contains no illegal or redundant moves.

private_information: You integrate validated move segments and emit the final multi-agent PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.
Keep actions for different agents distinct so the solver can preserve agency-specific constraints.
orchestrator.goal: Produce an integrated, validated plan and a final PDDL domain and problem that encode the two-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the given goal configuration, suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: Two-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent permissions: agent_1 may move A through H; agent_2 may move I through O.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, C, E; right peg has (top->bottom) B, D.
All moves must respect Tower of Hanoi legality: move one disk at a time; only move a clear disk; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
solution_ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk E from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right

plan_segment.system_prompt: You are the operator for disks A through H. Provide only your legal primitive moves to help achieve the stated goal; do not produce PDDL.
plan_segment.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Follow Hanoi legality strictly and avoid touching disks I to O. Use the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. An already verified ordered sequence is provided as reference in environment.solution_ordered_moves; return your segment consistent with that sequence.

plan_segment.system_prompt: You are the operator for disks I through O. Provide context or confirm no moves are required; do not produce PDDL.
plan_segment.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Given the initial and goal configurations, you should remain idle unless needed, which in this instance is unnecessary. Return a brief confirmation that you will perform no moves.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency. Verify that every move is legal, respects agent-specific permissions, preserves invariants, and reaches the exact goal. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and reject unverifiable steps.
audit.prompt: Audit the provided move segments against the environment initial state, legality constraints, and the target goal. Confirm that disks I to O remain on the left peg throughout. If everything is correct, produce an approval with a final validated ordered list; otherwise, provide a corrected ordered list in the exact primitive move format.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning. Produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver. Keep the actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct and encode agent-specific disk permissions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the validated plan and generate the final PDDL domain and problem for the 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks. Model pegs and disks, predicates on, clear, smaller, and distinct move actions per agent reflecting their permissions (agent_1 for A-H and agent_2 for I-O). The initial state is the full tower on the left peg. The goal is: left has F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle has A, C, E; right has B, D. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward (typed STRIPS style is acceptable).
